thread.title: Isaac Nauta, 5-star TE, cancels USC Trojans official visit
thread.title_full: Isaac Nauta, 5-star TE, cancels USC Trojans official visit | OregonLive.com

author: Andrew Nemec | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Isaac Nauta, 5-star TE, cancels USC Trojans official visit
text:
The USC Trojans 2016 football recruiting class continues to take hits with the news that coach Steve Sarkisian is taking a leave of absence from the program.
Following the Sunday evening de-commitment of Rivals five-star linebacker Daelin Hayes , consensus five-star tight end Isaac Nauta announced on Twitter that he has canceled an official visit to USC, and will instead take a trip to Alabama:
I have decided to flip my official from USC to Alabama for the LSU game #rolltide üêò
‚Äî ICE ‚ùÑÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è (@inauta18) October 12, 2015
The 6-foot-4, 237-pound pass-catcher, out of IMG Academy (Bradenton, Florida), is the nation's No. 10 prospect and the top tight end in the country, according to ESPN .
This summer at The Opening Finals at Nike campus in Beaverton, Oregon, Nauta was arguably the most dominant player during the week, rising from the nation's top tight end to arguably the top offensive skill player in the country.
One hand grab. Malik Henry to Isaac Nauta... get used to hearing that a lot at #FSU pic.twitter.com/qq2GH65oWr
‚Äî Josh Newberg (@joshnewberg247) July 8, 2015
Previously committed to Florida State, Nauta has offers from many of the top programs in the country and has scheduled official visits set to Georgia, Michigan, Alabama and TCU this fall.
Expect more bad recruiting news for USC in the coming days, however the program is likely to wind up with a top-four class in the Pac-12 Conference regardless of the current situation surrounding Sarkisian.
USC has a big-time brand, but it has clearly taken a hit this week.
-- Andrew Nemec
anemec@oregonian.com
@ AndrewNemec
